# GitHub Pages Deployment Workflow
# Automatically builds and deploys your project to GitHub Pages
name: Deploy to GitHub Pages

# Workflow triggers
on:
  # Automatically deploy when code is pushed to main branch
  push:
    branches: [main]

  # Allow manual deployment through GitHub Actions UI
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      build_env:
        description: "Build environment (prod/dev)"
        required: false
        default: "prod"
        type: choice
        options:
          - prod
          - dev
      verbose:
        description: "Enable verbose logging"
        required: false
        default: false
        type: boolean
      download_source_files:
        description: "Download additional source files"
        required: false
        default: false
        type: boolean

# Required permissions for GitHub Pages deployment
permissions:
  contents: read      # Read repository contents
  pages: write       # Deploy to GitHub Pages
  id-token: write    # OIDC token for secure deployment

# Prevent concurrent deployments to avoid conflicts
concurrency:
  group: github-pages
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  # Single job that builds and deploys
  build-and-deploy:
    name: Build and Deploy
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    # Environment variables available to all steps
    env:
      BUILD_ENV: ${{ github.event.inputs.build_env || 'prod' }}
      VERBOSE: ${{ github.event.inputs.verbose || 'false' }}
      DOWNLOAD_SOURCE: ${{ github.event.inputs.download_source_files || 'false' }}

    steps:
      # Step 1: Get the source code
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0  # Full history for better build optimization

      # Step 2: Configure GitHub Pages settings
      - name: Setup Pages
        uses: actions/configure-pages@v5

      # Step 3: Setup Node.js runtime
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'  # Use stable LTS version instead of "latest"
          cache: 'npm'        # Cache npm dependencies for faster builds

      # Step 4: Install pnpm package manager
      - name: Install pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: 8  # Use stable pnpm version
          run_install: false

      # Step 5: Setup pnpm cache for faster subsequent builds
      - name: Get pnpm store directory
        shell: bash
        run: echo "STORE_PATH=$(pnpm store path --silent)" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Setup pnpm cache
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: ${{ env.STORE_PATH }}
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-pnpm-store-${{ hashFiles('**/pnpm-lock.yaml') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-pnpm-store-

      # Step 6: Install project dependencies
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      # Step 7: Build the project
      - name: Build project
        run: pnpm run build
        env:
          NODE_ENV: ${{ env.BUILD_ENV }}

      # Step 8: Upload build artifacts for GitHub Pages
      - name: Upload Pages artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: ./dist
          retention-days: 5

      # Step 9: Deploy to GitHub Pages
      - name: Deploy to Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

      # Step 8: Output deployment URL
      - name: Display deployment info
        run: |
          echo "üöÄ Deployment successful!"
          echo "üìç Site URL: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}"
